words.example: The river is the main source of water for the city.

words.meaning: 频繁的 经常发生的
words.example: He is a frequent visitor to the library.

words.meaning: vi. 获得成功，达到目的
安全的；平安的 n. (C)保险柜

words.example: You need a password to log into the system.
Please read the manual before using the machine.

words.meaning: vt. 使能够；使成为可能
完整的，完全的 vt. 完成，结束
从……以来；自从 conj. 从……以来；由于；既然
令人惊讶地；出乎意料地
words.example: Surprisingly, he agreed to help us without hesitation.
The king sat proudly on his throne.
A long shadow appeared on the wall.
The dog began to approach the house slowly.

words.meaning: 平均；平均数 adj. 平均的

words.example: He used a torch to see in the dark cave.
The spacecraft was launched successfully into space.
The storm was extremely violent.
He used a flashlight to see in the dark.
A beam of light shone through the window.
Curiosity drives people to explore the unknown.

words.meaning: 当地的；地方的 n. (C)本地人

words.example: This water purifier can remove harmful substances.
Failure is often the first step toward success.

words.meaning: 可再生的 可更新的
words.example: Solar power is a renewable source of energy.
She has a positive attitude toward challenges.
He enjoys reading during his leisure time.
Children should show respect for their parents.
We should not overuse AI when doing our homework.
The package arrived this morning.
He is aware of the problem.
He wanted revenge after being treated unfairly.

phrases.meaning: 在我看来 依我之见
phrases.example: In my opinion, learning from mistakes is very important.
She turned over the page quietly.
You should be aware of the risks before making a decision.
They set out for Beijing early in the morning.
He looked around but saw nobody.
She stepped forward to answer the question.
Edison saw failure as a step forward.
We had fun at the party last night.
We had a good time at the party.
She put on weight after the holiday.

phrases.meaning: 完成某事; 使. .. 处于. .. 状态

phrases.example: We should communicate more to build a better relationship.
Students should use AI wisely.
Have a good day at school!
A strange shadow began to approach his house.
Some people are sensitive to strong light.
He was in pain after hurting his leg.

phrases.meaning: 气候变化，指全球或地区长期气候模式的改变
phrases.example: Climate change is one of the biggest challenges facing the world today.

phrases.meaning: 可再生能源，如太阳能、风能等
phrases.example: Renewable energy can help reduce pollution.
We must face challenges with confidence.

phrases.meaning: 放下；写下；镇压（需根据语境理解）
phrases.example: He put down the book and stood up.
He ended up staying at home because of the rain.

patterns.meaning: 结果发现 事实证明
patterns.example: It turned out that he was telling the truth.

patterns.meaning: 在他做完某事之后（表示时间先后）
patterns.example: After he finished his homework, he went to bed.

patterns.meaning: 当某人正在做某事时（强调两个动作同时发生）
patterns.example: While she was reading, the phone rang.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验
examples: I have finished my homework.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用
examples: I have finished my work.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果
examples: I have finished my work.

grammar.title: 常用介词
grammar.definition: 用在名词、代词或动名词前，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等关系的词。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词/代词/动名词
usage: 时间：at+时刻, on+具体日期, in+年月季节长时段
地点：at+小地点, in+大地点/里面, on+表面
方式：by+交通工具/方式, with+工具/材料, in+语言/颜色
常见搭配：be good at, be interested in, look for, wait for, listen to

mistakes.explanation: arrive in+大地点，arrive at+小地点

mistakes.wrong: I go to school by a bus.
mistakes.correct: I go to school by bus.
mistakes.explanation: by+交通工具中间不加冠词

mistakes.wrong: I'm looking forward to see you.
mistakes.correct: I'm looking forward to seeing you.
mistakes.explanation: look forward to后面接动名词

examples: The meeting will be held at 3 o'clock on Monday.
She goes to work by subway.
He is good at playing basketball.

sub_topics.title: 介词to和for的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: to强调动作结果指向，for强调受益对象
sub_topics.structure: be important to sb.; be good for sb.
usage: to表示方向或结果
for表示受益或用途
examples: This book is important to me.
Exercise is good for your health.

sub_topics.title: 介词后只能接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: to do中的to不是介词
examples: without water
without eating

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法（后接名词或动名词）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法
sub_topics.definition: without表示“没有”，后接名词或doing。
usage: 表示缺少某物或行为
examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She passed the exam without effort.

sub_topics.title: 介词to的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 名词性用法判断
sub_topics.definition: 主语的含义

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.

mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示两者之间的比较
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时间发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示过去经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式（be动词用was/were）
usage: 表示过去发生的动作：I visited my grandma yesterday.
表示过去存在的状态：He was a teacher ten years ago.
表示过去的习惯：When I was young, I often played football.

mistakes.wrong: I go to Beijing last year.
mistakes.correct: I went to Beijing last year.
mistakes.explanation: 有过去时间标志词（last year），动词要用过去式

examples: She bought a new dress yesterday.
They were happy at the party.
I didn't watch TV last night.

sub_topics.title: 一般过去时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作
usage: 与过去时间状语连用
examples: I went to school yesterday.

grammar.title: 主将从现
grammar.definition: 在条件状语从句和时间状语从句中 主句用一般将来时 从句用一般现在时表示将来
grammar.structure: 主句 will do 从句 一般现在时
usage: 常用于 if unless when before after 等引导的从句
从句中不能使用 will 表将来
examples: If it rains tomorrow, we will stay at home.
You will miss the bus unless you hurry up.

grammar.title: 状语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作状语的从句，用来修饰主句，表示时间、条件、原因、目的、结果、让步等。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 从句，主句（从句可前可后）
usage: 时间状语从句：when, while, before, after, as soon as, until等
条件状语从句：if, unless (= if not)
原因状语从句：because, since, as
让步状语从句：although/though, even if/though
结果状语从句：so...that..., such...that...

mistakes.wrong: If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.correct: If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.explanation: 在条件状语从句中，用一般现在时表将来

mistakes.wrong: Although he is tired, but he keeps working.
mistakes.correct: Although he is tired, he keeps working.

mistakes.wrong: Because I was ill, so I didn't go to school.
mistakes.correct: Because I was ill, I didn't go to school.

examples: I will call you as soon as I arrive.
Unless you work hard, you won't succeed.
He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.

sub_topics.title: when + 从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: how to + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He stood up and left.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: I like English and math.
He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 过去进行时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时刻或某段时间正在进行的动作。
usage: 表示过去某时正在进行的动作：I was sleeping at 9 last night.
描述故事背景：The sun was shining and the birds were singing.
与when/while连用：I was doing homework when mom came back.

mistakes.wrong: I was watch TV at 8 yesterday.
mistakes.correct: I was watching TV at 8 yesterday.

mistakes.wrong: While I did homework, he was playing.
mistakes.correct: While I was doing homework, he was playing.
mistakes.explanation: while引导的从句常用进行时

examples: She was cooking when the phone rang.
What were you doing at this time yesterday?
They were playing basketball at 4 p.m.

grammar.title: 过去完成时
grammar.definition: 表示在过去某一时间或动作之前已经完成的动作，即'过去的过去'。
grammar.structure: 主语 + had + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去某时之前完成的动作：By the time I arrived, he had left.
在宾语从句中表示更早的过去：He said he had seen the film.
常与by, before, after, when等连用

mistakes.wrong: After he had left, I arrived.
mistakes.explanation: after/before引导的从句中，过去完成时可省略
没有'过去的过去'参照，用一般过去时

examples: When I got home, my parents had already had dinner.
She said she had never been abroad.
I had learned 1000 words before I entered middle school.

sub_topics.title: see后接do与doing的区别
sub_topics.definition: do表示全过程，doing表示正在进行
usage: 根据语境选择
examples: I saw him cross the road.
I saw him crossing the road.

sub_topics.title: see的两种宾补结构用法
sub_topics.definition: see后可接动词原形或doing作宾补。
sub_topics.structure: see sb. do sth. / see sb. doing sth.
usage: do表示全过程
doing表示正在进行
examples: I saw him cross the road.
I saw him crossing the road.

sub_topics.title: see sb. do/doing sth.
sub_topics.definition: see后接do与doing的区别

sub_topics.title: 双宾语结构
sub_topics.definition: 一个动词后接两个宾语
usage: tell, teach, give常见
examples: He taught me English.

sub_topics.title: 主语缺失问题
sub_topics.definition: 英语句子必须有明确主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语
usage: 不能用逗号连接两个完整句
必要时用it作形式主语
examples: It is important to protect nature.

grammar.title: since 的用法
grammar.definition: since 表示“自从”或“因为”，具体含义需根据时态和语境判断
grammar.structure: since + 时间点 / since + 从句
usage: 当 since 表示“自从”时，主句通常使用现在完成时
当 since 表示“因为”时，时态不受限制
examples: He has lived here since 2015.
Since it is raining, we will stay at home.

grammar.title: 根据上下文推断词义
grammar.definition: 通过前后文信息判断生词或多义词的含义的阅读技巧
grammar.structure: 结合上下文的语境、逻辑关系和已知信息
usage: 常用于阅读理解题
适用于不认识或一词多义的单词
examples: From the sentence, we can guess the meaning of the new word.
Even without knowing the word, we can understand it from the context.
